channel.title: First noteworthy model
channel.description:
Hey guys!
I haven't been in the modelling scene really but I decided to give it a shot. I've made some other models before this, but this one is the first I feel like showing to the community! What do you guys think? I'd be happy to get some feedback on it.
[img]https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/40305562/Bandos%20Mace%20(2).PNG[/img]
[img]https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/40305562/Bandos%20Mace%20(Lines).PNG[/img]
I must admit, I quite enjoy playing with shapes and making them into neat creations! :)

item.title: First noteworthy model
item.dc:creator: @hadlich4 hadlich4
item.description:
@hadlich4 wrote:

[quote=“Soulcist, post:14, topic:520243”][quote author=hadlich4 link=topic=638742.msg4305921#msg4305921 date=1369792056]
the reason i actually like this model mostly is because in rs you rarely see people running around with maces maybe if someone added in some decent looking ones and gave them good abilities people would like them
[/quote]
And I agree, and I think if more work would be put into this - it’d be awesome. I’m sure he’ll be able to do so.[/quote]

for sure if thats his first model

Read full topic

the reason i actually like this model mostly is because in rs you rarely see people running around with maces maybe if someone added in some decent looking ones and gave them good abilities people would like them

item.title: First noteworthy model
item.dc:creator: @hadlich4 hadlich4
item.description:
@hadlich4 wrote:

[quote=“Soulcist, post:12, topic:520243”][quote author=amy_webb link=topic=638742.msg4305820#msg4305820 date=1369778849]
Soul, it isn’t nice to say that you’re bored with the concept, it isn’t like he is doing it constantly.
[/quote]
Eh… uhm… let’s see… uhm poor choice made? I don’t know - it’s an opinion. It’s not like I think of this as horrible, I’m glad that he’s trying, and he should keep at it to get better.[/quote]

the reason i actually like this model mostly is because in rs you rarely see people running around with maces maybe if someone added in some decent looking ones and gave them good abilities people would like them

amy_webb:

Soul, it isn’t nice to say that you’re bored with the concept, it isn’t like he is doing it constantly.

Eh… uhm… let’s see… uhm poor choice made? I don’t know - it’s an opinion. It’s not like I think of this as horrible, I’m glad that he’s trying, and he should keep at it to get better.

Read full topic

item.title: First noteworthy model
item.dc:creator: @poopler40 poopler40
item.description:
@poopler40 wrote:

[quote=“amy_webb, post:10, topic:520243”]Soul, it isn’t nice to say that you’re bored with the concept, it isn’t like he is doing it constantly.

You’ve used too much poly around the spikes, but that is expected from a learner. Instead of getting detail just try to get shape, but this i mean instead of all of the detail added to make the spikes look authentic, just make it detailed enough so that we get the basic shape. With the handle, it is basic but still has too much poly on it considering. All you really need is one or two cuts as the handle is usually covered by the players hand and therefore the user doesn’t see it. As for the chains on the end, you don’t have to make those 3D, it only wastes polly. Try turning those into flat faces and making them doubled sided so that they can still be seen without taking up as much poly. The symbol looks fine, very nice actually considering, thought your method of attachment could have been better. Maybe you could have used half a chain to make it seem attached but this is fine, good for low poly.

Now that you have tried modeling, try colouring it. It would be nice to see what colour palette you added to this, and how well it expresses your ideas.

Good work, never the less. I look forward to seeing more models from you, don’t let negative comments get you down. Everyone in this community has received at least one negative comment toward their work, you just have to accept it and move on because there are others who want to see more.[/quote]

well said

Read full topic

item.title: First noteworthy model
item.dc:creator: @amy_webb1 amy_webb
item.description:
@amy_webb1 wrote:

Soul, it isn’t nice to say that you’re bored with the concept, it isn’t like he is doing it constantly.

You’ve used too much poly around the spikes, but that is expected from a learner. Instead of getting detail just try to get shape, but this i mean instead of all of the detail added to make the spikes look authentic, just make it detailed enough so that we get the basic shape. With the handle, it is basic but still has too much poly on it considering. All you really need is one or two cuts as the handle is usually covered by the players hand and therefore the user doesn’t see it. As for the chains on the end, you don’t have to make those 3D, it only wastes polly. Try turning those into flat faces and making them doubled sided so that they can still be seen without taking up as much poly. The symbol looks fine, very nice actually considering, thought your method of attachment could have been better. Maybe you could have used half a chain to make it seem attached but this is fine, good for low poly.

Now that you have tried modeling, try colouring it. It would be nice to see what colour palette you added to this, and how well it expresses your ideas.

Good work, never the less. I look forward to seeing more models from you, don’t let negative comments get you down. Everyone in this community has received at least one negative comment toward their work, you just have to accept it and move on because there are others who want to see more.

Read full topic

item.title: First noteworthy model
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

[quote=“ghostly150, post:7, topic:520243”]I dont understand where these comments are coming from? Really making me feel like I should quit right now with learning to model stuff.

Seriously guys??? Is this what this community has come down to?[/quote]
Well… that’s sort of the point of what criticism is… for someone that has shown what he or she has done with something, you know? Just learn from what people are telling you and do better next time, not a big deal.

Read full topic

item.title: First noteworthy model
item.dc:creator: @hadlich4 hadlich4
item.description:
@hadlich4 wrote:

i think its neat, want to see more of your work, maybe try to do something more unique though not something related to rs gods maybe just a thought but do whatever makes you happy also maybe lower poly count on your next model, but keep going dont worry, cant let peoples bad opinions bother you

Read full topic

item.title: First noteworthy model
item.dc:creator: @ghostly150 ghostly150
item.description:
@ghostly150 wrote:

whoops. let me see if i can fix.

Edit: Work now?

Update: I chose to make it into a mace, and then a Bandos items for a couple of reasons. One being that I read the other day that his preferred weapon is the mace. I wasn’t intending to make it a mace from the start though, it just kind of shaped itself while I was trying different things.

Read full topic
